noun.description: A bristle worm of the polychaete family (Nereidae).

proper noun.description: Any of the sea nymphs, daughters of Nereus. They include Thetis, mother of Achilles.
A satellite of Neptune, the farthest from the planet, discovered in 1949. It has an irregular shape, a diameter of 211 miles (340 km), and an eccentric orbit.

origin: Mid 19th century: from modern Latin Nereidae, from the Greek name Nēreus (see Nereid).
